website_summaries.verdict: A quality choice for anyone looking to move and store larger files with ease.
pros: We love the sleek, eye-catching design of the HyperX Savage
With larger storage and faster speeds, this model stands out amid the other Kingston models
Removable protective lid stays on securely
cons: Sits at a significantly higher price point than other models

customer_reviews.title: If you used Kingstons earlier Blue version of the HyperX ...
customer_reviews.text: If you used Kingstons earlier Blue version of the HyperX you might think this would be faster. You would be wrong. This thing is *much* slower, but don't listen to me... read the tech mag. reviews which I didn't bother to read which prove it.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Works Great with PS3
customer_reviews.text: Just got it. Plugged it in and my PS3 recognized it right away. No problems at all. Unfortunately, I can not find a way to backup (or copy) just the game data files to the device which was why I bought the 64gig version, but since it works with other devices I will be keeping it. To backup your PS3 you will need the 512GB version. Quite expensive and I hate spending so much money for a gaming console, but there was no other choice. Have ordered that one and expect it to work just as well with my PS3 as the first one.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Montana

customer_reviews.title: It's a great PenDrive, but connected to a USB 3
customer_reviews.text: It's a great PenDrive, but connected to a USB 3.0 port give all most the same speed that my old pendrive Kingston HyperX DT USB3.0. I make a benchmark with CrystalDiskMark 5.1.2 and the 4k Q32T1 test was very poor Read[MB/s] 6.846 and Write[MB/s] 0.032 I was disapointed, because the same test with my old drive HyperX DT was Read[MB/s] 8.706 and Write[MB/s] 1.123, this means that read or write, small files, under 4k files will take a long time with the HyperX Savage. But by the other side the test Seq Q32T1: Read[MB/s] 314.1 and Write[MB/s] 244.5, this means that the PenDrive will work good for large files of 1GB or more.
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: It's a flash drive.
customer_reviews.text: Was going to get an M2 USB enclosure and throw in a cheap M2 drive, but the M2 I wanted was sold out for a few weeks and I got tired of waiting. Empty, I got 330MB/s read and 185MB/s write. My old 16GB "Monster" USB 3.0 flash drive was 175MB/s read but only 15MB/s read and it was a bit painful to use.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Great drive!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what the original formatting was (probably some kind of Universal formatting so that everyone can see it) but I had to use Windows 10 to reformat the drive before I could see its full reach. After that process, I have no problems with it. I use it to hold movies and TV shows that I want to watch and there is no jitter or pixelation at all during playback.
customer_reviews.author: R. MCNERNEY

customer_reviews.title: It's really fast with sequential reads, but it transfers ...
customer_reviews.text: It's really fast with sequential reads, but it transfers 4K files at less than 1 megabyte per second. The result is that when transferring files in most real world scenarios, it's not that fast.
customer_reviews.author: Bill B.

customer_reviews.title: Good for large files, not small ones
customer_reviews.text: The overall throughput for large files (e.g. videos) seems to be as advertised. But for small files (e.g. 1 byte!), the transfer time is very inconsistent, sometimes taking 8 milliseconds, sometimes taking up to 4 seconds. I'd recommend for large media but not (for example) general backups. This is on a Mac with the drive formatted as standard Mac OS Extended (Journaled).
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: This particular flash drive memory stick does exactly what it entails it does. It works perfectly for my Xbox360 console as an added memory unit. The only discrepancy I have is, the fact that they put 512 GB but the total amount that I saw it actually holds is 469 GB. Other than that, this product is amazing. Definitely worth the money. It doesn't overheat or anything like that even after several hours of usage.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael

customer_reviews.title: High Capacity Mobile Backup
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could back up my files and carry in my purse in case anything happened to my domicile while I was away from home and/or unable to disconnect my backup drive and bring with me in an emergency. This small flash drive is perfect for that!
customer_reviews.author: carol jean

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative though and I would highly recommend the jump ...
customer_reviews.text: Very fast but not as fast as Lexar JumpDrive P20 64GB USB 3.0 Flash Drive - LJDP20-64GCRBNA. Good alternative though and I would highly recommend the jump drive.It is a little pricey even for Kingston.
customer_reviews.author: RL

customer_reviews.title: it’s no discount stick but I bought it for my Sharp Roku smart TV Live Pause feature and it works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: At $50, it’s no discount stick but I bought it for my Sharp Roku smart TV Live Pause feature and it works perfectly. No issues; I got what I paid for. It’s so fast that it even formatted 32GB in like 3 seconds!
customer_reviews.author: F.J. Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Very dissapointing
customer_reviews.text: The drive is slow. It pretends to be fast only with the first few MB of data. The it slows to the crawl. I bought it to replace my $70 SanDisk drive because I thought SanDisk was slow. Boy I was wrong. The three times cheaper SanDisk is in fact faster most of the times when copying or reading large number of files. Don't waste your money on this drive.
customer_reviews.author: Anula

customer_reviews.title: Super fast. Only downside is the case is big ...
customer_reviews.text: This little guy is a screamer! Super fast. Only downside is the case is big (thick) and can be a challenge to fit in stacked USB ports with other plugs. I ended up getting a 6" USB extension cable for it. But well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Scott S.

customer_reviews.title: RELIABLE, POWERFUL, FAST
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, great, great product. A fine device for backing up 512 gb of files. I have zero complaints and nothing but the highest praise. Especially if you have many photos, this is extraordinarily useful. I'd give it 100 stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick A. Gilman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I have bought Kingston USB Memory cards many times and have never been disappointed. What I like the least is the size - it is a bit big, which puts pressure on the connector.
customer_reviews.author: Octavio A. Vela

customer_reviews.title: Wicked fast!
customer_reviews.text: Wicked fast! I had trouble even eyeball benchmarking a copy of about 400 mb using the explorer copy dialog, the dialog would barelr display it happened so fast. My only comment is about the cap and loop. The cap has a pointy shape, and if you add the keychain loop, you can't easily store the cap. Not a big enough deal to dock a star though.
customer_reviews.author: Graham McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: Super-fast on my Type-C USB 3.1 ports.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely fast drive, as should be expected for an organization of Kingston's quality of its products and reputation.
customer_reviews.author: rdr

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculously fast!
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievably fast speed. I can record 16 tracks of 24 bit 96K audio simultaneously on a flash drive with not a single error. I never saw that coming.
customer_reviews.author: mr metropaulitan

customer_reviews.title: USB Plug End Snaps Off Easily
customer_reviews.text: Had one of these in a front port on my PC. Walked a little too close I guess and bumped it. Drive snapped in two, with the actual USB male tip remaining in my PC, and the rest of the drive on the floor. Completely unusable after that.
customer_reviews.author: Firefly

customer_reviews.title: Faster is better
customer_reviews.text: I used to buy the cheapest flash drives, but I've learned there really is a difference. The more expensive ones are noticeably faster and they're also well built. I've always preferred Kingston, but I imagine any name-brand drive is good.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: One of the best.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice flash drive with fast read and write speeds.
customer_reviews.author: DoctorMasterBlaster

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for HD movie storage.
customer_reviews.text: Fast with gobs of space. I do a lot of HD movies on the trails with 30 to 40 min at a time. Lots of data here with lighting fast transfer and play back.
customer_reviews.author: WDS

customer_reviews.title: DJ’s must have
customer_reviews.text: Love this thumb drive, I use it with my Pioneer CDJ Nxs!
customer_reviews.author: Jason D. Labaska

customer_reviews.title: Solid and gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: It does a solid job, not world class speed but plenty fast and very functional.
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: Drive died within 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought this drive to store and transfer my engagement and wedding photos. Within 3 months, the drive suddenly went into write-protected mode. I tried all formatting options available but it looks like the drive is dead and is no longer usable.
customer_reviews.author: FC

customer_reviews.title: Happy with purchase. I would buy it again!
customer_reviews.text: Happy with purchase. I would buy it again! VERY FAST!! quite happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: dragnet

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Happy that it is a lot faster than your average flash drive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 4-stars
customer_reviews.text: price is a little steep (else will be 5-stars), otherwise worked perfectly. fast file transfer, feeling a little heat at times.
customer_reviews.author: WN

customer_reviews.title: Still working. No problems.
customer_reviews.text: Have had it for years and still working good. I use it a lot, every day.
customer_reviews.author: steve b

customer_reviews.title: no issues at all so far
customer_reviews.text: been using two of these as bootable USBs, no issues at all so far.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Live it. It's fast and sturdy. I never worry about breaking it.
customer_reviews.author: Casper

customer_reviews.title: I used this to set up windows 10 via usb ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this to set up windows 10 via usb when I had to reinstall due to switching motherboards. It was the fastest windows installation i've ever done.
customer_reviews.author: david ford

customer_reviews.title: Best pendrive i ever bought
customer_reviews.text: The capacity and speed are amazing, i can travel and download pictures and files, and there is always space for more.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Aranda

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Thumbdrive
customer_reviews.text: Have used these for years with my job. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: andre medrano

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Spacious
customer_reviews.text: Fast, and spacious. Did I mention fast? Nice case as well... feels like it can be run over by a truck!
customer_reviews.author: M. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Great drives.
customer_reviews.text: They cut the backup times down significantly. Size is just fine.
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Impressive speed
customer_reviews.text: This device is so much faster than my other USB 3 flashdrives that it is now my drive of choice with the others being relegated to storage only.
customer_reviews.author: Ungerdog

customer_reviews.title: USEFUL!
customer_reviews.text: I love HyperX in general, but when looking for a good and safe way to store data this was by far my best purchase of a thumb drive!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: FAST Transfers!
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Super fast transfers! I can copy entire VMs in couple minutes. <3
customer_reviews.author: Job Russ

customer_reviews.title: Slower than the 256 GB version.
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with the 256 GB version of this pen-drive, so I purchased the larger 512 GB one, advertised with the same write/read speeds. But, it is definitely slower than its smaller counterpart, it writes at about 20 MB/second and then it stalls for a while, probably waiting for the cache to be written. It resumes and stalls again, either with a large number of small files or one large file. I find this pretty disappointing for a rather pricey memory stick with "Hyper" names.
customer_reviews.author: Hector Cori Traverso

customer_reviews.title: I cannot believe 512GB in my pocket!
customer_reviews.text: It's fast, the cover fits well and its not as bulky as previous 256GB stick.
customer_reviews.author: J. Churchill

customer_reviews.title: Faulty fake? Product .. maybe..
customer_reviews.text: Received a faulty product. When I plugged in , it only says 10gb available
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: i keep it with my keys and it does not look too bad
customer_reviews.text: durable, i keep it with my keys and it does not look too bad yet
customer_reviews.author: Mihail

customer_reviews.title: Recommend to anyone wanting high capacity plus fastest transfer speeds
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly with Windows 10 and Linux. Speeds vary from 100 mb/s to 240 mb/s. Recommend to anyone wanting high capacity plus fastest transfer speeds
customer_reviews.author: Cindy burton

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Loaded 5 gbs of photos videos and other in easy a few minutes
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Ruel

customer_reviews.title: Great USB drive
customer_reviews.text: Great USB drive! But if you want to use it with MS SurfaceBooks, buy one without that red X logo! The SurfaceBook is too thin to properly insert the USB drive if the SB is placed flat on the desk.. :(
customer_reviews.author: ajh320

customer_reviews.title: One device died on me after one month of use, the second after a day of use. Possible issues with Linux file system?
customer_reviews.text: This device died on me after one month of use. It became unstable and then stopped working altogether, The little LED no longer lights when I plug it in and several PCs cannot access it. I ordered a second. The second device failed after formatting with EXT3. I think that this is what happened with the first device. It appears that perhaps these items have a problem with Linux.
customer_reviews.author: old programmer

customer_reviews.title: really good investment
customer_reviews.text: superb , fast , portable and rugged , really good investment
customer_reviews.author: kufflincs

customer_reviews.title: Solid and powerful
customer_reviews.text: This flash drive is very fast and has a high storage capacity. To top it off, it looks epic and it feels solid in the hand. I am very happy I bought this item over a cheaper flash drive. You will too.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan S.

customer_reviews.title: Great brand
customer_reviews.text: Great product as always! Kingston is a great brand to use

customer_reviews.title: Fast
customer_reviews.text: Excellent storage device so far and faster than any other flash drive that I've ever owned

customer_reviews.title: Bought it for my son's PS4.
customer_reviews.text: Just what was needed!!! Fits the PS4 USB Port perfectly.

customer_reviews.title: KDHX Savage 64GB
customer_reviews.text: This flash drive have an amazing data transferring speed and handy design.

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed to store all my music. Great product. Thank you

customer_reviews.title: Extremely fast
customer_reviews.text: wow this is the fastest usb drive i have ever used

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome fast storage and good for watching movies from Xbox

customer_reviews.title: Super Fast!
customer_reviews.text: Ridiculous Fast! I love it. Faster that my internal hard drive for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Richard R. Vera

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, but ...
customer_reviews.text: Good USB stick - works ok for me. My only concern is that the stick does not reach the transmission speed as promised.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Had it for a while and still work like new
customer_reviews.author: Mex

customer_reviews.title: One pretty much works
customer_reviews.text: I would never buy this again. I bought two. One pretty much works. Not so fast, but it works. The other one is unusable. I was able to back up a drive to it initially, but it now works at a crawl. Think Kbps transfer and operational speeds. I cannot even format it I have tried everything. I am no novice to storage and flash devices. This one was an expensive dud for me. I would love to send it back in, but am not even sure I could securely erase my data from it first, so I'm stuck. Never again. I think I'll stay away from Kingston, in general now.
customer_reviews.author: Paul V

customer_reviews.title: Fast, durable, fair price.
customer_reviews.text: Fast, durable, fair price. I did not microbenchmark this but quite frankly durability and reliability concerns outweigh a few MB/s in transfer speeds and there I'm pretty happy with this drive. It does not feel "cheaply built" or what not. Its clearly not waterproof or anything but I think it should hold up well to day to day use.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: You will need to reformat
customer_reviews.text: So you purchase a large capacity extreme USB-C drive and it come formatted FAT32? The reason I bought a large fast drive was to make quick work of large files. I was unable to get to work with large files and had to figure out it was a FAT32 problem. Now that it’s reformatted it works great but I have to admit I don’t understand the logic of shipping it that way.
customer_reviews.author: amazon

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work and check out. Came brand new from the package. I checked it myself how ever it's not the full 512gb the actual total is about 468gb when formating the partition and selecting Allocation unit size for any one who is curious or wondering. Also there is no fat32 option but can easily be converted with guides over the internet. Over all for the price not too shabby I highly recommend buying this product. I ran it on a operating system of windows 8.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The speed is great, and the size of this SSD is even ...
customer_reviews.text: Use it to edit raw pictures and videos. The speed is great, and the size of this SSD is even better. I am thinking of buying a larger one to install Steam and play my games through it instead of installing them in my computers.
customer_reviews.author: GQL1981

customer_reviews.title: Lots of room
customer_reviews.text: I use these to load my movies on so we can watch them from computer or TV on the boat.
customer_reviews.author: Karen L.

customer_reviews.title: 256 GB - Not Kingston - be warned again!
customer_reviews.text: Tested the stick Got - about 15% of advertised writing speed. Reading was OK. From comparison with earlier published tests this is not the real thing. I'm, returning it. This stick was to provide a write speed of 250MB/s. Test was with VERY large files (1GB) that would facilitate fast writing. See test image from Linux on Xeon processor.
customer_reviews.author: CTI

customer_reviews.title: BEAST 512gb 3.0 Flash Drive
customer_reviews.text: This IS THE DRIVE you want! Amazing speed and price. Very pleased, GREAT LOOKING too!

customer_reviews.title: Love it. I have a few of them
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I have a few of them. Very fast read and write times. I use them with my Pioneer CDJ 2000's and Rekordbox. Songs load instantly...no lag!

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Been using this now for quite a while = works great, quality product.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really fast, on My Asus Rog G752 350MB/s ! Runs warm. My only fear to loose the tap...

customer_reviews.text: Paint fades really easily, and its not really that much faster than a standard drive.

customer_reviews.title: wow
customer_reviews.text: all i have to say is wow, check out the speed tests on youtube, its very fast for me. I use both MAC and PC

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly Fast
customer_reviews.text: This drive is very fast, if using a Usb 3.0 slot. Large file transfers were amazingly quick
customer_reviews.author: LSF007

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Kingston is a trusted brand for USB drives. Maybe not the "bleeding edge" in performance, but reliable and they work. After 2 bad drives from another manufacturer (rhymes with horsehair) had to be sent back I bought this drive and have no complaints. This USB stick is fast and has 256GB capacity, which is great for such a mobile device.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great USB. Fast Speed and Delivery on Time. Recommend for DJ's.

customer_reviews.title: ... with at least 490GB not 468GB so I'm not happy about that
customer_reviews.text: The size says 512GB but when i put the drive in the computer the size is 468GB so I'm missing some GB for the price it should comes with at least 490GB not 468GB so I'm not happy about that.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Christian

customer_reviews.title: Scam
customer_reviews.text: This is a scam. Does not work on Xbox One.
customer_reviews.author: Jon McKeel

customer_reviews.title: 3.1???  Ahhh!!! Really!!
customer_reviews.text: I buy this to use with a Asrock PCIex4 USB 3.1 Adapter (ASRock Card (USB 3.1/A+C)) (ASMedia ASM1142 Controller). I have to say that this Flash drive is very good but I think isn't 3.1. I have a USB 3.0 (Kingston too) and performance is almost no difference. 90-100mb/s, no more... The external rubbed aspect .... I love it...!! Check USB 3.1 products offered at CES 2016, and if you have now 3.0 ones, wait for 3.1 ver2.
customer_reviews.author: J. Z. Arce

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Put it in my ps4 and it needed a bigger flashdrive to store games
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Strohecker

customer_reviews.title: Fast
customer_reviews.text: Use for video recording storage on streaming devices. Unit plays video with no limitations.

product_meta.title: HyperX Savage 512GB USB 3.1/3.0 350MB/s R, 250MB/s W (HXS3/512GB)
product_meta.description: Size:512GBHyperX Savage USB Flash drive offers blazing fast speeds up to 350MB/s (Speed may vary due to host hardware, software and usage) to save time during file transfers and let you quickly access, edit and transfer files from the drive without any performance lag. The HyperX Savage USB provides plenty of room for large digital files such as movies, hi-res images, music and more. It's compliant with USB 3.1 Gen 1 specifications to take advantage of USB 3.1 ports in desktops and notebooks and also backward compatible with USB 3.0 and USB 2.0. HyperX Savage is a stylish drive, with a sleek black casing and signature HyperX logo in red and an aggressive look. It's designed to work on multiple platforms and game consoles (Check with console manufacturer for support of this feature), including PS4, PS3, Xbox One and Xbox 360.
feature_bullets: Blazing fast transfer speeds - HyperX Savage delivers blazing transfer speeds of 350MB/s read and 250MB/s write to save time and let you quickly access files with no performance lag.
USB 3.1 Gen 1 functionality - HyperX Savage is compliant with USB 3.1 Gen 1 specifications to let you take advantage of USB 3.0 ports in newer notebooks and desktops.
Bold design - This stylish drive has an aggressive look that complements the latest PCs and consoles. Its sleek black casing is accented with the signature HyperX logo in metallic red.
Multi-platform compatibility - Use this versatile drive on multiple platforms, including desktops, notebooks and gaming consoles, including PS4, PS3, Xbox One and Xbox 360.

Its slim design fits in tight console USB ports, and it lets console users quickly transfer their profiles.Compatible with:Windows 10, Windows 8.1, Windows 8, Windows 7 (SP1), Windows Vista (SP2), Mac OS X v.10.8.x+, Linux v.2.6.x+, Chrome OS

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,206 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
